org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.server.components.dbviews.base.tableview

Class DBTableContainer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.pikater.web.vaadin.gui.server.components.dbviews.base.tableview.DBTableContainer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.vaadin.data.Container, com.vaadin.data.Container.Ordered, com.vaadin.data.Container.Sortable, java.io.Serializable, ICommitable

    public class DBTableContainer
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.vaadin.data.Container.Sortable, ICommitable
    Low-level DBTable view provider. Asks database for the currently viewed data and then passes them to the table.
    Author:
    SkyCrawl
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getPresentationType

        public static java.lang.Class<? extends java.lang.Object> getPresentationType(DBTableContainer container,
                                                              ITableColumn column)
        Return content class for the given column/cell. The table is homogenous and descendants of AbstractTableDBView directly require/imply it.

      • getProperty

        public static com.vaadin.data.Property<? extends java.lang.Object> getProperty(DBTableContainer container,
                                                               ITableColumn column,
                                                               AbstractTableRowDBView row,
                                                                value)
        Vaadin tables work with "properties", instead of working directly with values. We have created our own, with a little extra nice features.

      • getUnconstrainedQueryResultsCount

        public int getUnconstrainedQueryResultsCount()
        Return the total number of rows for the currently viewed database table. This is needed for table paging to work.
